name: Geniverse
project_card_description: Explore heredity and genetics by experimenting with breeding and studying virtual dragons.

name: InquirySpace
project_card_description: Use probes, models, and data analysis tools for open-ended investigations similar to the approach used by real scientists.

name: SEPA
project_card_description: SEPA students explore the connections between genetics and the environment with simulations and by creating and modifying models.

name: SmartGraphs
project_card_description: Learn algebra using graph-related activities, and get scaffolds and hints to help make sense of graphs.

name: SAM
project_card_description: The Science of Atoms and Molecules project offers research-based activities for physics, chemistry, and biology.

name: VISUAL
project_card_description: The Visualizing to Integrate Science Understanding for All Learners  project studied how visualizations can transform science instruction.

name: Evolution Readiness
project_card_description: A set of 10 activities help elementary students learn Darwinâ€™s model of natural selection using models of interacting organisms and their environments.

name: UDL
project_card_description: Universal Design for Learning principles offer a flexible approach to teaching science. Activities for grades 3-6 include probes and computational models.

name: Interactions
project_card_description: Students explore how interactions of matter and energy at the atomic level explain phenomena across physics, chemistry, and biology.

name: Electron Technologies
project_card_description: Using advanced computational models of electron behavior, students prepare for careers in nanotechnology, photonics, and materials science.

name: Next-Generation Molecular Workbench
project_card_description: Next-Generation Molecular Workbench software provides visual, interactive computational experiments that run in Web browsers.

name: Engineering Energy Efficiency
project_card_description: Design and build an energy-efficient scale model house using simulations and probeware, and  learn about conduction, convection, and radiation.

name: High-Adventure Science
project_card_description: Investigate the mechanisms of climate change, learn how scientists use modern tools to find planets around distant stars, and evaluate whether underground stores of water will be sufficient to support a growing population.

name: SPARKS
project_card_description: SPARKS provides realistic simulation-based assessments for students in college-level introductory electronics courses.

name: Teaching Teamwork
project_card_description: Electronics students learn how to work effectively in teams. By logging student actions, the project hopes to find ways to assess the contribution of each team member.
